item.title: How to Quickly Create an Encrypted USB Drive on KDE Plasma
item.description: Need to create an encrypted USB drive? Are your running KDE Plasma? Then great! Here are 6 simple steps on how to quickly and painlessly create an encrypted USB drive with KDE Partition Manager. Let’s start a. Start by inserting your USB drive b. Now launch KDE Parition Manager and type your password c. Select the USB drive and right click to delete the existing partition ⚠️ WARNING: remember, this will delete all your existing files)
